TopicTitle: My rover is only stable in turns in one direction.

Articles.Content: When I turn the rover to the left, it sticks to the ground. The wheels only go into the air when I turn it to the right(this was tested at 22 m/s).:rolleyes:Also, rcs only fires in one direction when I drive forward.
pics? if you load it in the space plane hanger does the center of mass lean towards one side of the craft ?
It looks like the Center of mass is rotated.
yes, looks like it is.. but it's in the middle so the only thing i can think of is the wheels not being perfectly symmetrical.. or the pieces they are attached to
Oh ok then. I will try that in the second version.

i could be wrong tho. i've had strange things happening in the SPH as well, especially planes veering left or right on the runway for no apparant reason.

maybe -just maybe- you might maybe be able to maybe fix it by taking the wheels off, setting symmetry to radial ® and putting them back on again. or even attaching them one by one by eye
No, the reliance of that rover on RCS is a major flaw. I need to find another way to introduce grip anyway. The rcs is too heavy for effective sporty use.
